more_content:
New York is kicking off the new year with an exciting lineup of events. These annual winter festivals celebrate music, food, art, culture and fashion. If you’re visiting New York in January or February, mark your calendar for these events. 

Winter Jazzfest

Date: January 8–18, 2020 
Location: Multiple venues in NYC
Tickets: Prices vary from show to show. Consult the official website for more information.
See the best of local, national and international jazz artists at New York’s Winter Jazzfest. 

NYC Restaurant Week

Date: January 21–February 9, 2020
Location: Multiple venues in NYC
Cost: 2-course lunch $26, 3-course dinner $42
Restaurant Week is the best time of year for foodies. With hundreds of restaurants across the city taking part in this annual event, you get to choose from some of the best, trendiest, and most unique eateries in New York. 

NYC Broadway Week

Date: January 21–February 9, 2020
Location: Multiple venues in NYC 
Tickets: 2 for 1 Broadway tickets. Prices vary from show to show.  
If you have a long list of musicals and plays you want to see, Broadway Week is your dream come true. Get 2 for 1 tickets for classic musicals, the most recent debuts and award-winning shows. 

The Westminster Dog Show

Date: February 8–11, 2020 
Location: Pier 94 and Madison Square Garden 
Tickets: Prices vary from event to event. Consult the official website for more information.
The Westminster Dog Show returns, better than ever. Last year’s top dogs stole the show and this year is bound to be the same. See the preliminaries at Pier 94 or the grand finale in Madison Square Garden. 

New York Fashion Week

Date: February 6–9 2020 
Location: Multiple venues in NYC
Tickets: Prices vary from event to event. Consult the official website for more information.
New York Fashion Week takes place twice a year, in winter and fall. This 2020 can be your year to restock on stylish trends or experience fashion in a new way. Most runway shows aren’t open to the public, but many events are. Browse the public events closer to the date for more details. 

Chinese Lunar Year Parade and Festival

Date: February 9, 2020 at 1pm
Location: Parade starts at Mott & Canal and continue to Chatham Square and East Broadway towards the Manhattan Bridge. It finishes on Eldridge and Forsyth Streets towards Grand Street next to Sara D. Roosevelt Park.
Tickets: Free event 
The 21st Chinese Lunar Year Parade is back with the best of Chinese culture. See the dragon and lion dancers parade through the heart of Chinatown, take part in the Firecracker festival or sit down with a hearty and authentic Chinese meal. 

Have your hotel room ready before the year ends. Consult the latest offers and book your stay at The New Yorker Hotel, the most iconic hotel in Midtown!
